Package remodel.io

Class ModelStreamer

java.lang.Object
java.io.Writer
java.io.BufferedWriter
remodel.io.ModelStreamer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class ModelStreamer
extends java.io.BufferedWriter
ModelStreamer is a buffered writer to support serialising ReMoDeL models, metamodels and transformations. ModelStreamer is the streamer used by writers in the ReMoDeL toolset. It writes text blocks to the underlying output stream, offering line break and tab indentation options in addition to the write() methods inherited from BufferedWriter.

ModelStreamer implements the Closeable interface (by virtue of extending BufferedWriter), so may be used in try-with-resources blocks to guarantee that the ModelStreamer and its underlying output stream is closed.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • ModelStreamer

      public ModelStreamer​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates a ModelStreamer writing to a file using the default UTF-8 character encoding. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to an OutputStreamWriter, writing to a basic FileOutputStraem opened on the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the output File.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.

    • ModelStreamer

      public ModelStreamer​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates an ModelStreamer writing to a file, using the specified character encoding. Recognised encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16, ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1) and others. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to an OutputStreamWriter with the given encoding, writing to a basic FileOutputStream opened on the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the output file.
      encoding - the name of the character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes this ModelStreamer. Closes the underlying output stream, unless that stream is System.out, in which case it is flushed instead. The standard output stream is closed upon termination of the Java runtime. Otherwise, all nested streams are recursively closed.
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class java.io.BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if closing fails.

    • getTabString

      public java.lang.String getTabString()
      Returns the current tabulation string. This String represents the number of spaces to use for each level of indentation.
      Returns:
      the tabulation string.

    • setTabString

      public void setTabString​(java.lang.String tabString)
      Sets the current tabulation string. Changes the number of spaces used for each level of indentation.
      Parameters:
      tabString - the new tabulation string.

    • newLine

      public void newLine() throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a newline according to the operating system platform.
      Overrides:
      newLine in class java.io.BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output error occurs while writing.

    • writeIndent

      public void writeIndent​(int level) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes an indentation to the specified indentation level. Writes the current tabulation string the specified number of times.
      Parameters:
      level - the indentation level.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output error occurs while writing.
